text:
That patty melt continues to be the best we've had. This time got it with a side salad, which was also pretty excellent.

I tried the sliders, which to be quite honest had slightly dry buns and the burger meat tasted unimpressive. I wouldn't order it again, personally. On the up-side, the sweet potato fries were again excellent, and stayed remarkably crisp and delicious even as they cooled.

Just like my last review: The staff were super friendly and cool people, the restaurant was clean and comfortable and looked great. We're absolutely coming back, even just for the patty melt.

We came around early lunch time. Delicious food! Great menu. We had the bomb diggity nachos , Brentwood burger and the jalapeño burger.
Yum! Friendly staff/ clean environment. Private bar with smoking section.

Came in on a Saturday night, the bartender was super hott and did great at managing all the people at the bar by herself. 

Do yourself a favor and order the macho nachos. Delicious.

I've been to a lot of bars in the area. This one exceeded my expectations. I don't expect much from bar food other than deep fried everything and chili cheese you have it. I had the house burger and my husband had the jalapeño burger. SO GOOD! You can taste that the burgers were house made. They were well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The prices were fair, the service was good and the food was great!

Went here on the morning of 7/15/15 around 5:45am. The doors were locked so I used the intercom panel to get buzzed in. I guess the person working there didn't realize they had activated the intercom because I heard a male voice on the other end say "what the f**k do these two idiots want?". Then the door buzzed to open. I did not go in. My wife and I left immediately.

Ordered food from them thru a delivery company.  The driver was made to wait an additional 25 minutes, for 2 orders, one being a RARE cheeseburger.  Absolutely ridiculous!  The dessert was fried and they stuck the ice cream in the same container.  Of course it was melted by the time it got to us.
I got the all American burger with Onion Rings that were real good , everyone was nice clean restaurant!!

Pretty delicious!

We went here on a Friday night a few weeks ago and it was a nice experience.  Decor is nice and subdued - very warm and inviting.  Not your typical video poker bar with restaurant added as an afterthought at all.  Hubby got a ribeye, son got shrimp scampi and feeling a little under the weather, I got a veggie omlette (I forgot the official name of it on the menu) and hot tea.

I loved how they brought out a huge selection organic tea for me to choose from with a big teapot full of perfectly hot (and delicious - not from tap) water.

Hubby and son were extremely pleased with their entrees - I think I made a slight mistake ordering breakfast at night though - the eggs were on the rubbery side but the ingredients and cheese on the inside were definitely on point and the delicious potatoes with the omlette were amazing.  I think it just sat out a little too long while waiting for the other entrees to finish.  

It actually took awhile for me to order - lots of delicious (and healthy / organic) items to choose from.  It will be so nice to bring our vegetarian daughter back and have options for her to choose from besides salad.

The server was very friendly and was nice enough to place my husbands grilled asparagus on the side just because I mentioned that it sounded delicious when he declined it so I could feast on it !  I loved how grilled asparagus was a side instead of the normal frozen vegetable medly that normally gets served at restaurants like this.  I believe I may have had the server mentioned below - I am glad I did not read that review first because she was very pleasant, accomodating and prompt without being overbearing - a nice balance.  I would much rather have friendly and slower than fast and grouchy.

We are definitely coming back - some of the pizzas that were coming out of their wood pizza oven looked heavenly.  Next time though I will save my veggie omlette ordering for breakfast time...

The food is very good and prepared specific to yor likes. The ambience is absolutely wonderful I am amazed this place is not busiier  I would highly recommend it for Sunday brunch or meals any day of the week
No prices on any website. i am retired and not driving across town to find out even though the hangover breakfast looks yummy.
Amazing food and staff !! Breakfast is wonderful,  banana foster French toast is one of my favs! Happy hour is great as well !

I have been to the Brentwood dozens of times now and i have never been unhappy. Staff is awesome, everyone remembers my name as well as my favorite order and i feel at home every time I'm here. Every sunday morning i go there for the eye opener which is eggs, bacon, hash browns, and toast. I also get an order of biscuits and gravy ( which are some of the best in town ) every thing is always seasoned beautifully and the prices are extremely affordable! For lunch or dinner i love their burgers they come on a magnificent brioche bun, and the appetizers are to die for. Some of my favorite apps are the tex mex spring rolls - just a little spicy, very good. I also like the pretzel bites which are exactly what you would expect with some queso cheese on the side. In all this is not ordinary bar food by far they have so many other things i have to order but I'm stuck on my regular favorites i haven't had the chance to order them yet! 
This really is a place you must try and i put my reputation on the fact you will love all the food and the staff will welcome you with open arms! 
Thank you to all the servers on staff that make me feel like I'm their most important customer, its you wonderful ladies and gentlemen yhat make this place feel like

Terrible service. The chicken Marseille was overly drenched with sauce and overwhelming. Also the philly cheese was sub par with very little meat. However, Randell was very helpful and personable. Out of 10 people working he was the only
 standout and the place only had 6 guests.
Great food in a great environment. The Chicken Artichoke Sandwitch is good, and the portions are big.

I love this spot. Great food, fantastic service. What's awesome about this place is that it manages to balance the dining and bar environments exceptionally well, and almost independently of each other.

I was very excited when the Brentwood opened because it is stumbling distance from my house, but after my experience here I won't be back.  We sat in the bar area for 10 minutes and were never spoken to.  I'm not sure if it's because we weren't gambling or what?  But after 10 minutes of no service (we timed it), we left.  Big disappointment.
Great customer service, friendly and professional bartenders and good drinks. The whole crowd's awesome and the atmosphere is enjoyable.

Their bar food is incredible! Enough said! Decent beer prices and wow the food was great. 

Coconut shrimp actually tastes like it has coconut and the sauce is great.
Philly was flavorful, the pizza was decent. Oh man if this becomes my new watering hole, I might be in trouble because the food is just that good. Plus they have interesting nights like Karaoke & Taco nights.

Very upset with this establishment.     Went here for Monday Night Football.   Was with teenage daughter.   Unable to see any tv screens from any of the booths on the non bar side.... Asked if we could move to section by big screen tv was told no.    That section is closed.

Horrible Service- The dining area isn't busy other than a painting party.  Waitress is horrible and has attitude.  Ordered our sodas and Nacho appetizer from what seems to be the buzzer.  Waitress came up following that to take our order that was already done.  She then brought sodas and barely looked in our direction.  We told her that we were going to order regular food after the appetizer.  She then came back about 5 minutes later and wanted to take our food order.  We declined as our nachos had not come out yet and didn't want the meal to come right after it.  We received a disgusted look and she walked away.  When we told her we were ready to order she said just a minute and disappeared in the kitchen for 5 minutes.  She then walked past our table and said she needed a minute to get a pen. About 3 minutes later she walked up and said "K" and took our order.  Food was good and had to go to the bar to get our soda refills myself.
Regular bar food and their breakfast is not too bad.  Construction in the area is terrible.  I will stop in sometime whenever the roads get fix.

Ahi salad was miserable. Tuna tough, obviously frozen then placed on flat top. Couldn't cut with a knife it was so tough. Too much wasabi in the dressing, had such a bite to it that the fresh greens couldn't be balanced. The wontons need an upgrade, too much crunch in contrast to the lightness of the tuna. Can't please em all.

Good drinks.  Chill atmosphere and fun night of karaoke.  Wonderful staff and fantastic food. We will definitely return next Saturday for karaoke and ad the regulars are super friendly and the staff makes us feel welcomed.

Best Halloween decor I've seen. Awesome staff. Super cold draft beer. Try the beer battered fries. Some of the best I've had. We were a party of 13 and every meal was cooked just right.

The kitchen is now open again and they are serving their full menu. This is a terrific SW business. Consider giving them a try.

This place is pretty good. We have been only to the restaurant section not the bar. The food is good. I had the goat cheese pizza and it was fantastic. Also every time we have been here the service is very slow which is why we don't go back more often.

Went here on a Saturday night with my family for dinner. When the server came to get our drink order, we each asked for water ( there was eight of us) and we also ordered nachos and some other appetizers. She came back with 5 waters and informed us that they were out Tortilla chips. Next we ordered another appetizer. The server came back and told us they were out of that too. My sister ordered a drink and they couldn't make it so she got a chocolate milk that wasn't mixed up.  I ordered a glass of red wine and when i said the name, the server looked at me like I had three heads. I had to explain to the server that the restaurant she worked at served a specific brand of wine and that is what I was asking for. Our server kept disappearing for long periods of time even though there was only one other table of two in the entire place. It took her forever to finally come and take our dinner order. Where we were sitting, we had a view to the kitchen line and a few of our dishes clearly sat under heat lamps for a while. My sisters dish was crispy and dry when it shouldn't have been and my mom's was dry on top and soggy on the bottom. Oh, and they must have been rationing water as well because despite asking twice for refills, we never got them. In short, service sucked, food was alright. Definitely will not be going back.

My daughter and I stopped in last night for the first time. We ate in the bar as they were closing the restrauant side.  We were told by the bartender (sorry forgot her name)  if we wanted to eat over there it would be fine but they had just cleaned up so we opt for the bar. Even though there is smoking it wasn't bad. Now on to the service and the food. Can I say WONDERFUL, FLAVORFUL, GREAT SERVICE, and the Price was more than REASONABLE.  Chips tasted like house made, artichoke dip was great and not filled with Mao like some places.  We ordered Goat Cheese pizza, INCREDIBLE. Bartender (she was also the food server) was so pleasant and made sure all her customers were taken care of. The whole bar and entrance is decorated with Halloween and I mean DECORATED!!  Menu has several choices and a 24 hour Breakfast menu, my favorite meal.  Thank you so much, just purchased a groupon, we will be back..

Over all great place carey always with great service ready to work ,. he patiently explained the menu to me . Tamara always with a great attitude and the nicest personality !! I love this place! Brian also with great service  to the top !!

After reading the glowing reviews, I decided to purchase the Groupon and give this place a try. Big mistake.

We went on last Saturday evening around 5:30 and ordered our drinks and appetizer. The waitress (who looks about 13) came to take our order and when my husband ordered the rib eye steak she informed us they ran out of it. (FYI, it's the ONLY steak on the menu.) We decided to come back the next weekend when they would have the rib eye.

Tonight we went and were happy when they said they had rib eye. My husband ordered the steak and and was given a choice of two sauces to go with it. Of course, they were out of the sauce he chose so he was stuck with the other one. I ordered the chicken fettucini alfredo but was told I was not allowed to order it because we were using a Groupon and it's not considered a "dinner entree". Nothing looked too exciting so I settled on the fish and chips. 

Our salads and appetizer (Southwest Egg Rolls) came out and both were tasty. Then came our dinners. At least, I think that's what it was supposed to be. My fish smelled fishy as soon as it was put in front of me.The fries were covered in glistening grease and were overcooked and soggy and when I asked for vinegar was told they "were out of it". (Anyone sensing a theme here?) I had exactly one bite of the fish and it tasted awful and I had exactly one fry. I am not a picky person (I mean it!) but that was the first time in my life that I left a meal basically untouched. My husband said his steak was really fatty but liked the veggies and potatoes.

Please don't waste your money here! The young waitress seemed oblivious to the fact that I hadn't eaten my meal because it was disgusting and when an older server came by and asked me if I liked it I told him no that the fish was bad and the fries were soggy.  He took my plate and that was it. No "I am sorry" or "Can we make something else for you?" Reading the other reviews I would swear that we were at a different restaurant.

We ate Christmas breakfast here with the kids.  Everything was delicious. Our waitress and the rest of the staff were very friendly.  The food all came the way it was ordered with attention to detail.  My husband ordered the grits and was pleasantly surprised at how good they were.  This was our third time dining here and we have always had a good experience.  We look forward to our next visit.  I highly recommend the Brentwood omelet, it was fantastic as were the Tenaya potatoes.  We hope they are around for a long time, it will become a Christmas tradition to eat breakfast were.

Wonderful, warm and friendly restaurant! I found it by searching through Groupon. The restaurant has a warm and cozy atmosphere and is especially beautifully decorated for the holidays right now.  I was in the mood for comfort food and saw online that they had meatloaf and raced over here. The generous portion of meatloaf was absolutely delicious! Plus the mashed potatoes were soft and creamy.  We also ordered the Chicken Picatta.. Wow! delicious! My mom said on a scale of 1 to 10 she gave it a 20! And she is very picky ! It was made with fresh lemons that you could actually taste, fresh chopped mushrooms and served with soft warm garlic rolls. Alicia was our server and she was absolutely delightful! We will be back for sure even without a Groupon!  ;)
I went here for the open mic last night (Friday).  Everyone was super nice and friendly.  Down to earth very talented musicians vibe!!!
The food is great and priced just right....$15 bottomless mimosas...No wait to get seated and glass was never empty...bartender is friendly...highly reccomended

My friends and I love coming in here and Tamara is our favorite bartender! The beer is good along with the coffee. Come hungry because the nachos are to die for! I can also walk home if I need to so that's a plus

We held an event here, and it went so well! Laurie was very accommodating, and the food and drinks were fantastic. A few people in our group are gluten free and she made sure the food we ordered was gluten free, even going so far as to research ingredients online.
Overall, the look of the place, the food, the drinks, and the service were all great.

This place is the hidden gem of Vegas.
Good music. Not too loud.
Even better bartenders.
Woodfire Pizza is SO good.
Excellent food. And never too crowded.
Check it out before you can't find a seat
because this place is going to take off!

This place is awesome the bartender Brian is very attentive, you know you're in good hands when your bartender never leaves your drink empty. The nachos are amazing, jalapeño burger is awesome. Saturday nights are karaoke night pretty fun

The food is good, but I don't know about the service. They seem to be confused and disorganized. The young man we had as a server (i think he's the cook as well), is ok. Last time we were there, other 2 women kept coming to us giving us utensils and napkins when we already have em. Also kept asking what we ordered when they're supposed to be the one who knows that. Its just weird..
Was very disappointed with my last experience. Had corned beef and cabbage and half of my meal was nothing but fat. The food, even the appetizer, was lukewarm.
Just finished eating the junkyard skillet. A flavorful meal just the way I like it. Hash browns were crispy. I will be back tomorrow.

Shout out to Ginger, her boys and Christina. Had my daughter's graduation party here and they all did an amazing job. The place looked great, service was top notch and we had a great time. Thank you for helping us make her day a great celebration!!

This was my first visit to Brentwood Cafe. Stopped in yesterday morning for breakfast. The interior is beautiful. I loved all the wood. The booths were so comfortable. 
We were greeted right away. The servers were so nice and very attentive. 
We ordered breakfast, the BF ordered the pancakes, they are huge. They were delicious perfectly cooked. 
I ordered an omelet wit the Tenaya potatoes. it was great. Perfectly done. 
We will go back and try the dinner. 
We enjoyed everything about this place. Felt very comfortable here.

Great little place off the beaten path.
For a little neighborhood bar, this place has a very upscale vibe.

Nice bar, great patio, and awesome bar food.  The steak salad there is one of the best I've ever had.  

A lunch spot favorite!
Ginger and the staff are absolutely incredible! ..fun place great food and drinks!!..

Loved my food! The Tavern Salad was fresh and delicious. Balsamic dressing was really good. Missing pralines though- I was looking forward to those  The veggie pizza on gluten-free crust was the best anywhere! I would prefer more sauce. The veggies were very tasty too!

What an awesome breakfast find! We had 2 different skillets and they were great. The hash browns had great flavor and nice thick wheat toast. Not crowded, prompt and friendly service. Looking forward to going back and trying lunch and dinner. Michael Grimm is playing there Thursday night's , we want to check his show out too!!

We had 6 in our group and all ordered something different. Everything was excellent. Try the enchiladas. The manager was so friendly. The decor is appealing Will definitely go back when in the area again.

I agree with prior reviews.. I haven't a clue as to why this place doesn't seem to have much business.  Maybe location?  Killer menu, great service and an incredibly clean restaurant..  What's the problem?

I ordered the pepperoni pizza, with the loaded (and I mean loaded) nachos and some of their gourmet mexican style corn.  All of it, bravo.  Delicious.  I've been dreaming about the corn ever since.. I've ordered it to-go twice but currently on a mission to make from home.  However, the cotija cheese is not easy to come by.  

Overall, I LOVE this place.  There are so many little bars/gambling saloons that are open 24 hrs.... This place is so much more.   I seriously hope they get more business so that I never have to say goodbye to such an incredible menu.  Location might be playing a part in that.

If you have some late night munchies - go check these guys out!  You won't be disappointed.   They also have an awesome breakfast menu.  

Love that you guys are just around the corner from my house!   Keep doing you!

I honestly can't believe that I didn't give this hidden gem a chance sooner. Took the family for breakfast last month and we're hooked! We've had their breakfast lunch and dinner,  all have been amazing. Service has always been great,  even when the bartender is serving on the restaurant side. The presentation of meals is excellent and the food quality matches. I've taken my wife there for drinks after work several times now,  it's our new spot. Just to name a few dishes we'd highly recommend,  the veggie skillet,  sliders,  and eggs benny.

We will not be going back! Average food, bad service, horrible management, and a nice facility. If they didn't have the bar area, they would be out of business. Out ketchup was contaminated (tasted like beer) and the manager made no effort to rectify the issue and didn't even talk to us though she walked by our table three times and asked the server for the ketchup bottle. The service was super slow and the server was eating food while we waited for ours. The place is also understaffed for its size, but I guess that's ok since it is empty and awful. My daughter's burger bun had green stuff on it and we asked them to replace the bun. They brought it back out and said the cook had some guacamole on his gloves and they didn't replace the bun because they said she'd have to wait too long for them to remake it.The other food we had was actually decent.  We've been going here for a few years and knew it was mismanaged but we never had an experience this terrible until now.

Came in today at noon, and was a little taken back, as I was the only customer.  They have a separate section for the food side, so I didn't ser if there were bar patons.

I was going to have a late breakfast, but decided to have a patty melt instead. One of the best melts I have ever eaten. The marble rye bread was terrific,  and the onions and cheese added to the perfectly cooked burger.

They gave me a card for a free meal after you buy 10.

I will be back.

This place is a great little local bar but VERY SMOKY, which sucks for those of us who don't smoke. This could be solved by more ventilation. The drinks are good and the service is mediocre but I like coming here for karaoke. Be prepared to wait because the host doesn't rotate in new singers before current singers sing twice. This is uncool but it happens. I sat for 1 1/2 hours and listened to one guy sing 3 times meanwhile, I still had 11 singers in front of me before my first song. BAD FORM as a host.

Great place :) the menu has a great variety I had breakfast and it was  amazing :) I am excited to go back and try lunch and dinner :) we has Jesse as our server and he  very pleasant :) we even played a game of darts after !

I just finished this and I can honestly say it was one of the worst meals I have had in recent memory. The mac and cheese made a cheap Velveeta dinner seem high class. It was bland with a cheese "sauce" and I put it in quotes because that is as close as I could come to identifying it. For the burger to offer options on a temperature of your choosing is a joke as it comes as well done as a fast food burger. It had so few onion straws that we didn't believe they were included until we pulled it apart and realized there was a light orange color where the straw batter is assumed to have been though no actual straws were found. Now the real gem, the meat loaf. This is the equivalent of a kid cuisine meal except in a kid cuisine you get a dessert and the corn doesn't suck. They also flat out forgot the salad that is listed on the website as included with the meatloaf though they charged us a $1.50 for as if we added it and then didn't even include it in our bag. This, like serial killers, proves that some things are bad through and through. ~
Saturday swings. The bartender is adorable. Makes a great drink. Great service. And the girl isnt bad either
Never again.  Staff was very rude and seriously felt like they didnt even want to be there!

Ended up here for lunch a couple days back on complete accident (was looking for a different restaurant) it was lunch time so it was very quiet but it looked like everything had just been remodeled. Bar area was awesome and dining area was very clean and comfortable. 

The food was delicious, I had buffalo wrap and my wife had the bbq chicken salad both of which I would highly recommend. 

You won't be disappointed

I ordered the seared ahi salad. The dressing is thick and delicious. I finished my plate right away. We also got an open-faced chili burger. The presentation is beautiful. Great service. I'm coming back.

This place was pretty dead when we went in. We sat in the restaurant area rather than the bar since they don't allow smoking. 

The mozzarella sticks were pretty good and probably the best part of the meal. I ordered the bbq bacon burger with fries and it was sub-par. The fries were cold and a little soggy so I politely asked the waitress for a new side of fries. The burger wasn't anything special; not bad but not great. My husband ordered the french dip and I didn't care for that either. The bread was a bit stale and the roast beef was really dry, even after dipping it in the auju (sp?) sauce.

Save yourself the mediocre experience and go next door to volcano grille!

The couple times I've been here have been very nice. The bartenders are super friendly  and the drinks are the usual price you would pay for near the SW area. My only complaint would be the non existent room for activities lol. Its a great bar if your a football fanatic, seeing as they are constantly playing the game, but there are no pool tables or shuffleboards . On the other hand, the food is awesome and priced as a Happy Hour entrees. Good spot to grab a drink on the way home.

I hate to give this place a bad review because the service was really good!  the food on the other hand, can be better.... didn't seem to be to busy, but  it's in a hidden location and not visible on the major streets.  

i'm not going to speak for lunch or dinner options.. but we came in for brunch and my son, husband, my daughter, and myself ordered breakfast... and have had better.  i've made better...  

on a brighter note, the presentation of the caramel banana pancakes was nice.  

again, the service was friendly.... kinda slow in the kitchen... but, can't complain... our meal was on behalf of a gift certificate we won at a school function... 

glad we were able to try it!
Nicely decorated place with great food. Friendly staff and management. Get the burgers - hand-formed patties and buns bought fresh daily from a local Italian bakery.

With two friends in town and many local friends off from work, we sought Saturday brunch. The trouble was I worked  til noon and most brunches end by 1pm.

Enter The Brentwood Cafe and Tavern, which serves breakfast 24 hours a day, is just around the corner for all the locals, and - to my delight - offers gluten-free pancakes or waffles upon request. 

We all agreed to meet around 1pm, which gave me enough time to go home, change, and drive over. Parking in their lot is very easy - plus points! 

When we walked in, we were seated quickly which, for weekend brunch, is a miracle - plus more points! 

I quickly scanned the menu and, to my sadness, realized that only a portion of the breakfast menu was offered 24 hours a day. The pancakes/waffles/french toast and scrambles/skillets are actually only offered 11pm-11am. That was all relieved when we were told they would be able to accommodate requests from the 11p/11a menu - super plus points (thank you so much for this)! 

Some of the group ordered bottomless mimosas which, at $15 served in large glasses and refilled quickly, is quite the deal. Others ordered coffee that smelled heavenly. Others still ordered micheladas. 

Each person ordered something different which, for me, meant getting to sample a little bit of a lot of things. 

We had:

- Nutella Waffle

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ

This I think would translate better aspancakes or french toast, but it was well done 

- Junkyard Skillet

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#ghuaYb6VN8fyjfx5n9YGLw

Massive and glorious. It was far larger in portion than expected. It was wonderfully cheesy, eggy, and meaty all at once and left more than enough for leftovers later. 

- Brentwood Ranchero 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#rKQwZfeOnz9nBHUKEbGTMA

We considered this a perfect hybrid between a huevos ranchero and chilaquiles - like crispy, cheesy, breakfast nachos. With the beautifully over easy egg, avocados, and cheese sauce, it was very well received. 

- Bomb-Diggity Nachos

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#UmiSoiQbj_-HqeUZdJslCA

The person that ordered this question the level of "loadedness" and was ecstatic to find a mini sheet tray covered with meat covered cheesy chips before her. Definitely delicious!

- Brentwood Burger

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#B3Np1BqE8JisK02sK2pLYQ

My husband at this too quickly for me to really assess it, but he ate the whole thing. Onion rings were on point. So there. 

- GLUTEN-FREE Banana Pecan Waffle

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#Pb8wBGAM7OIYMnUuHNx6Ag

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#WZhgjuqkK6y6f2zyn9T--w

Gluten-free waffle or pancakes upon request caught my eye, especially because it didn't incur an additional $4 fee or whatever can be charged elsewhere. Having tried gluten-free pancakes, I went for the waffle and - OHMYGOSH. The waffle was so fluffy I would argue it was better than the regular waffle (see nutella waffle from this trip). It was so good that it was just a "good waffle" versus being a "good for being gluten-free waffle". My stomach lining thanks you, Brentwood... I must return for blueberry, nutella, and root beer.. 

- All-Star Root Beer Float PANCAKES

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#iDxRnwyTsQAth_wIiNzS8Q

Yes, PANCAKES. Okay, so I know I made a big to-do about needing gluten-free options, but I did break my avoidance to catch a taste of these pancakes out of sheer curiosity. They are literally a root beer float in pancake form and I need to try these soon without the gluten. 

- Hangover Breakfast

The description on the menu reads like this:

red beer or loaded absolut bloody mary with a breakfast slider with sausage, bacon, fried egg & cheese

I honestly planned on getting the protein scramble but I felt this had to be tried. Therefore, I changed my selection to this just before our orders were taken. 

My expectation: a slider on a plate with a bloody mary to drink 

What I got was this, which explains why I was told my drink was coming with the food: 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-brentwood-cafe-and-tavern-las-vegas?select=D4KL_j2txk5O5jzsCEtPtQ#BAkvEgQIDpnyxuNfJiJpCw

This was a true OMGWTFWOW moment. Not only was it an awesome monstrosity, the bloody mary and slider were both excellent. The drink hit all the right flavor notes and the sandwich was fluffy, buttery, melty, and meaty. 

We were all so pleased with our visit and had a great afternoon together.

It's a-ok. It's a fairly standard 24-hr, neighborhood bar and restaurant. Though, the lights are almost bright here and the restaurant area is pretty ample. The barstools are in need of serious repair. 

The food is alright. Standard, insignificant, run-of-the-mill fare (or at least for what we've tried so far). It's all edible and will hit the spot. But none of it is crave-worthy. Though, I will say that the full-size burgers are probably substantially better than the slider versions. I'd definitely be willing to come back and try a full burger.

The bartender we had was friendly and attentive. Beer offerings are pretty standard. They have $15 bottomless mimosas on the weekends. 

They also do karaoke here. It's not too bad. Though, the space is a bit awkward for it. I do, however, like that I can sit at the bar and have a great view of the karaoke proceedings. 

Note: If using that Groupon you purchased, despite it being for $20 towards food and drinks for 2, and clearly not stating must purchase 2 entrees, they will try to force you to order 2 entrees.

All in all, an a-ok, average place. I'd be willing to give it another try. If I lived in the neighborhood, I could see myself stopping in frequently for a beer.

Today is Easter 2016, everybody wants a nice place to eat with good food and small crowds, here is your place! The food and service are excellent and because this place is off the beaten path, the wait for food is minimal. They can take a large group or a couple, they have food service and bar service, fantastic!

All you can drink mimosas are back! And so is football on all the tv's for that matter! Even better this time it's now on Saturday and Sunday! To my surprise they also have a new "Hangover Breakfast". The Hangover breakfast in a nutshell is a handcrafted bloody mary( not a shitty premix) and topped with the usual suspects, a breakfast slider w/egg, sausage on a brioche , w/BACON! Too continue my journey to obesity we ordered the "Bomb-Digity Nachos". They don't cheap out here either, no up charge for the goodies like homemade guac, pico, fajita style veggies. Though I can't remember the price I know they were reasonable. I think our bill for 4 of us w/the unlimited mimosas, 2 hangover breakfasts, nachos, and the Nutella Stuffed Waffle (I didn't try it for fear of exploding but looked to die for) after tip was under $80! 
Can't wait to go back next Sunday for brunch again. Next time we will bring Charlie, our golden retriever as I learned on the way out they have a dog friendly patio. 
It's good to see this neighborhood bar back on track with a new menu, happy hour, and friendly staff!

Here you'll find true pub food with the friendliest staff I've ever had. I love it when I'm made to feel appreciated   And this place did it from the time we got here and all the way through. 
The food was awesome fresh and hot. I will always stop here every time I come to Vegas.
This is an excellent restaurants. I have held business networking events and laurie is always helpful and fantastic. This is a great venue for your events.
Billy! You rock!!!!! He makes the best Vodka Tonic! Seriously.

Had really high hopes for breakfast for Mothers day, so we went to Brentwood Cafe. What a MISTAKE that was! We were seated immediately, and it was not really busy at all. However, we waited over an hour and half for our food which never came. After my wife's first Mothers Day was ruined and she was in tears we left. Never again will I or my family return. Thanks for ruining her first Mothers Day!

Had one of their bartenders in my bar and she was a delight. So I decided to return the favor and this place is right down the road, how convenient, since my other fave neighborhood bar went downhill, I've been looking for a new place with GREAT food. It's a regular bar with contemplorary flare. They had an open band night, fun and the other male bartenders were friendly, but didn't really talk to me much, but I didn't mind since I was focussing on my poker! I got the sliders and I loved them, I later brought my husband who is hard to please and decided to get the pesto chicken sandwich which was ok, I wouldn't order it again, not enough bold flavor to me, too bland actually. My husband liked the sliders but thought they could of been more juicy. I love that they have Original Sin Cider among other great beers they offer in a goblet. I will definetly come visit more often!!!

I came here last Sunday with my boyfriend. We both had gotten up pretty late but we were craving some breakfast. I looked at yelp and the reviews seemed decent so we headed down here. We came around 3 and we seated ourselves in the huge dining room. It was past lunch time so it was pretty empty although the bar area looked really lively. A nice guy named Jesse came by to greet us and let us know that breakfast wasn't being served anymore for the day but that he could probably get the kitchen to make it for us anyway! My boyfriend and I were extremely happy with this so we ordered breakfast. I got the junkyard skillet and subbed strawberries for the toast and my boyfriend got the strawberry cheesecake french toast. The food was amazing! We both inhaled our breakfasts and my boyfriend enjoyed the coffee.

The main reason I am writing this review is because of Jesse. It's not every day that I come across someone so happy, nice and attentive. We really appreciated Jesse. He made our breakfast dreams come true and did it all with a smile! We will definitely be back thanks to him! Plus I want to try their nachos :)

Great service come see Alicia she is amazing and may I say very attractive! Tamara is awsome she is a bartender here and super sweet and also very attractive great visit I think I'll move in lol. The food is so yummy.

Not a fan. Empty restaurant but the staff wad just sitting around instead of tidying up. The 4th booth we tried to sit at was reasonably clean. Door between the bar and restaurant wad propped open, making the whole place smell smoky. Dust was visible on all counters. 

Server was not very attentive. Considering we were her only table, I would have expected her to try a little. Nope.  

Food:  Nachos are supposed to be their specialty but the cheese wasn't even all melted. And why so stingy with salsa?  Fish & chips were decent but the fries under the fish were oily and soggy. Ahi tuna chips were ok, but there wasn't even a hint of asian flavor in this dish. It tasted like a sweet vinaigrette sauce. 

2 stars is generous. Not coming back again.
Food is great!!!   They do however need more servers!!!  We waited long to order, get food and finally eat, then longer for the bill.

Not only did they run out of champagne, aka no bottomless mimosas as promoted, they didnt have menu items -that are printed on the menu!- available to order. The service was lackluster and frequently our party of 6 was forgotten, in an empty room! This place used to be awesome, but this has been by far THE most disappointing experience I have EVER had here. Obviously there has been a change in staff and DEFINITELY a change in cash flow. Everythjng iz done with the most minimal effort, and it shows in the food, service, and upkeep! The servers' attitudes were as digusting as the food, according to my party. I personally didnt order anything, and never will again. They dont derserve my money or YOURS!!!

I am trying to use up this Restaurant.com gift certificate thing I got and I can only use like ten dollars of it at a time. 
Decided to grab some food here with Hunnie Bunnie after school. 
Walking in your nose gets invaded with cigarette smoke before you open the doors and get inside the dining room area. 
We were immediately met with someone though and promptly had a server as we were the only ones in the dining room.
They have a kids menu, which is always nice. Hunnie Bunnie enjoyed her pasta with marinara.  
Plus a giant vanilla sundae we ordered after.  
I had some grilled chicken, cheese, bacon, lettuce, avocado, cheese sandwich minus the bread and mayo with a side of fries. 
It was delicious and the fries were served hot with a light seasoning on them.

I can't say enough good things about this place.  The food is amazing, everything I've gotten off the menu has been really good.  The spinach dip is probably my favorite.  

The bar (separated from the restaurant) is awesome as well.  The drink prices are reasonable ($3 for a domestic pint, or a huge goblet for $7) and all the bartenders are friendly and really know what they're doing (Brian, Tamara, Nick, Jesse).

Karaoke on Saturdays is always a blast, and the machines pay out slightly better than most bars.

They have Golden Tee which my friends love but I can't get into.  One thing I wish they had was a dart board!  They used to have one but took it out.

So apparently they changed their menu, I'm not sure what the older menu looked like but the new one is limted. I decided to try this place becuase of the the yelp reviews and pictures. Well most of the items they no longer serve. The service was ok, the food was below average for bar food (see pics), lettuce was wilted and slimy on both the appetizer which was tuna poke wontons and entrée was seared ahi salad, the server asked if I'd like them to get me new lettuce which makes no sense if your getting the salad from the same bag of lettuce. So no thanks. We were still charged for everything, no manager came by, no apology nothing.

DO NOT ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT  I ordered from bite squad and let me tell you I do not wish what happened to my two greyhound show dogs to happen to anyone else.  I ordered the sliders so that my hounds would get a little treat.  when I placed the order thru BITE SQUAD  I wrote in the comments  " no onions"   well the delivery arrived and assuming that this restaurant would do as instructed handed each dog a slider  , well they were loaded with onions    both dogs were extremely sick  that night and the following morning we were at their vet's office when they opened  when I explained what happened the vet took both dogs back to their treatment room and administered treatment. along with lab work  the bill was close to $500.00  when I called BITE SQUAD and told them to alert the owner of the situation bite squad issued a credit for the sliders  when I called back again they credited me the entire meal which I had ordered chicken picatta .  36 hours later my one dog was crying and obviously uncomfortable  at 2am I made a trip to the emergency vet facilty on DURANGO AND TROPICANA  they did more lab work and xrays and thought that because of the onions that this dog was suffering from pancreatitis  which even in humans is a very painful disease.  at 6:30 am I left the emergency vet facility and drove to my vet's office.  when the doctor saw the condition of my poor dog he ordered more xrays and kept my greyhound for observation  . this all would have never happened had it not been for the moron who ignored the  "no onions" notation on the order.  the emergency vet  charged me another $450.00 and i am sure my vet is not going to be cheap either.  I believe because of the negligence that this restaurant should be responisble for the vet bills.  this all could have happened to a child or and adult who may be allergic to onions  that could also cost  my dog his life.  I know I will never recommend this restaurant  to anyone.  food should be safe no matter who eats it

Disclaimer:  I've only been here for lunch.

My company recently moved to this side of town and Brentwood was really courting our business, so we thought we would try it.

I've been twice and other coworkers have tried it a few times.  I've got to say I have yet to speak to anyone who had a positive experience.  The first time we had a decent waitress and everything was average.  The second time was ridiculously bad.  There were only 2 of us and we both ordered burgers - after waiting 45 minutes(!!) we finally received our burgers.  Both orders were wrong in more than one way.  Its hard to believe the kitchen could make 4+ mistakes on 2 plates when there was only 1 other table of people there - its not like they were slammed.  The other thing that bugged me - they clearly just took my plate back and scraped off what I didn't want and left remnents of it all over the plate.  I HATE that.  Don't be so damn lazy - give me a NEW plate.  At least try to hide the fact that you probably just scraped it off with a fork and hid the evidence with a new slice of cheese.

Their menu is limited but the food would be decent if they actually got it right, or cared what you actually ordered.

This might be fine for dinner when you have plenty of time to wait but for lunch its just not worth it for me. 


Tip to Brentwood:  When people show up at 12:10 with ID badges hanging from their clothes, they're on their lunch break.  They don't have time to wait 45 minutes for a burger when they have to be back to work in an hour.

They might as well close, went there last week for breakfast with some friends and was told the kitchen wasn't opening today. Then went again today, after standing there waiting to be seated for 5 minutes someone finally came out, i said are you guys open today the lady replied "well that depends what you want".  I immediately turned around and walked out.

Awesome staff members, amazing food, 12 beers on tap and they have 24/7 gaming!! 

My personal favorites from the menu are the tex mex rolls, nachos, the homemade pizza and the hangover breakfast!

Two happy hours during the week from 3-6pm and midnight-6am, can't beat that... plus they have football specials for NFL games as well as Karaoke EVERY saturday starting at 9pm! You have GOT to check it out if you are in the area, you will NOT be disappointed :-)

3 stars because Service was AWESOME but selections make sure I will not be back. 
I really want to say that the bartender was awesome and I hope he can go work at a place with more than just a few beers. Like I said service was great. 

How does a bar not have Guinness or Sam Adams? My two favorite beers/brands just not around. 

Food was good, but again I wish there was more than just burgers or sandwiches. 

I sure hope the place changes a little bit so I can come back because it was a good place just needs a few additions.

The place was empty  when we went. A Saturday  afternoon. The food was good and the price was fair, but nothing  special. If you live in the area and your looking for a quick meal this the place. I woukd not travel more than a few miles though.

This place is in the middle of nowhere. Well actually I only say that because this side of town is pretty foreign to me. 

It's a pretty cool spot if you live in the area. My friend had a birthday party here and she got to rent out the whole outside patio. It was a cool night so it wasn't too hot. Everyone that was there for her got a stamp so you can get half off appetizers, well drinks, and beer on tap. The beers on tap was pretty good. 

They have karaoke and the DJ was awesome. He seemed like an aspiring rapper. 

The prices for the the food and drinks were pretty reasonable not too pricey. This place is pretty cool we had a good time. I probably won't be coming here too often considering is pretty far from me but if I was in the area I wouldn't count this place out.

Just decided today to take our father to Brentwood for Father's Day brunch. Thinking it was going to not take as long as the popular restaurants in the area...however...we were sadly mistaken. The staff is lazy, slow, and incompetent and we had to actually get up and leave after waiting 30 minutes without even getting a drink order! Do yourself a favor, get much better food and wait an extra 5 minutes somewhere else. This place is really struggling and will not be open very long if they keep this up. Very disappointed with the service here, especially on a day when we are trying to celebrate with our dad.

From out of town, we wanted to try something off the strip with a relaxed environment. This place had good reviews and queso-something you don't find often on the west coast. (For the record they do not serve queso-just melted shredded cheese.)The waitress-also the hostess-was the only service provider in the restaurant besides one bartender. Very nice, but not very good. We attributed this to the fact that she'd been an employee less than a week and did not blame her, but management. Took a long time to get our orders, we, along with all other customers were looking for the waitress most of the time we were there. I ordered nachos with chicken which I was later told they were "out of". I asked if I could get steak for the same price, and the waitress stated there was no manager on duty for her to get permission from. I found it very odd that there was no manager on duty on a Saturday night, and that the restaurant was out of a main ingredient. When my food finally came it was wrong. 2 hours and $80 for 3 people later, we were all unbelievably disappointed and agreed it was one of the worst dining experiences to date.

Went to Brentwood Cafe for lunch with my husband. Service was ok. The server never introduced herself. She did mention some upcoming promotions at the restaurant which I thought was helpful. Anyway...on to the food review.

My husband and I ordered the same sandwiches, yet I requested the turkey as the protein, and he chose the chicken. The kitchen made the order incorrectly and also put mushrooms on his sandwich when he requested it to be omitted and mine was missing the mushrooms. This type of problem bothers me because the kitchen cant make the food order correct and then it gets brought out without being checked. I decided to eat my sandwich, sans the missing mushrooms, while my hubby's sandwich got sent back. In the end, we had to take his sandwich to go because he ran out of time for his lunch break. Very frustrating. Then my husband calls me from work saying that he found a huge chicken bone in his sandwich while biting into it. Felt bad for him cause he was very hungry and had to take his sandwich all the way to work and ended up finding a bone in it.

Overall, the service was mediocre and the food was ok. Not coming back based on the lousy kitchen service. Honestly, it ruined our lunch.

My sister, father, his mother-in-law and myself had just left a showing of Wicked at the Smith Center and were looking for a place to have a late lunch/early dinner.  I suggested Brentwood since it's never packed and the food is always good.

We got there and I was delightfully surprised to discover that they're currenlty retooling the restaurant and bar to accomodate fans of the Texas Longhorns.  Unfortunately, during this retooling session, the bar was a little sloppy.

The menu was very small, they were limited on drinks and they were streaming the Longhorns game on a slow connection, so it kept freezing up to buffer.

I'll be honest, the only reason I'm giving this place four stars is because despite the remodeoling faults, my food was delicious and I can't wait to see what this place is like when they're settled and everything runs smoothly.

Although we pass by here quite often, on our way to do errands and shopping at Arroyo Crossing at Sam's Club, Walmart, Marshalls,  etc., I never would have thought to stop here, if we hadn't purchased a Groupon.

SOOO glad we did! The jalapeño burger was out of this world!!! If I am craving a burger from now on, none other will do! It is piled mile high and the secret sauce is unbelievable!  I got sweet potato fries with it, which were absolutely scrumptious without any ranch or ketchup...but once my husband talked me into trying the ranch dressing, I was hooked!  It is hands down the best ranch dressing I have ever had...and it is homemade!!!

My husband got the California chicken sandwhich and was also very pleased. It comes on ciabbatta bread with bacon and avocado.

The portions were large  and the atmosphere is quaint and cozy. 

Thanks to our server, Aleisha! She was very pleasant and attentive.

Good stuff here!  Personally I think much better than your average bar food establishment (IE PT's)!

My networking group meets here twice a month and every time I have a good experience.  Service 5 Stars, Food 5 Stars.  Great BURGERS!!

What more can you ask for??  Try it if you haven't been there already!

UPDATED REVIEW: PLEASE READ BELOW!!! Outstanding. My family & I have driven by this place so many times & I've always been intrigued and curious whether or not they were good. Last night we went and ordered a ton of food (courtesy of our groupon which is a great deal btw). Although we had to wait maybe 20-25 minutes for our food, it was well worth the wait. Everything was extremely fresh and our waiter was also really nice as well. Definitely gonna come back in the very near future. 
.
.
.

Very unfortunate that I'm having to update my review. This place went from a 5 STAR review down to a 1 or 2 star restaurant. The food was not nearly as good as last time, the pizza tastes like frozen pizza, the $9 chicken tender meal was literally the size of a McDonald's happy meal, it was SO small. The portion size of the nachos was cut in half, very disappointed & probably won't be coming back here again. Sad.

Second time coming here, didn't want to yelp it till I came back just to have more experiences.

FOOD
My friend and I ordered the Brentwood Burger, Nachos, and a Quesadilla. Everything was made to perfection! The food was more than satisfying and the service was great. Every time. 

DRINKS
We sat in a booth in the bar area. The waiter/bartender Jessie was an outgoing guy and very attentive. He suggested a few drinks and normally I'm not a fan of Gin, but he definitely sold me on it. Along with the other 2 I ordered. By far, one of the best cocktail places I've been. Plus the draft beers are $2! 

SERVICE
Like I said, been here more than once and every time they waiters have been awesome. 

I would recommend this place if you want to go for drinks, lunch, dinner. Perfect atmosphere for any occasion! :)
Another visit and another great experience. ..hidden gem! Great service as always food was excellent.

My go to spot always! I love the bartenders and the food is great :) I'm a picky eater and they never screw my salad that I order up! Prices are great! My boyfriend and I are here 2-3 times a week and are always pleased each time!

I'm never going to get a great local atmosphere you can go in the game inside and play different games while you're eating and drinking or you can go to the dinner side with your kids no smell of smoke and they have one of the Megatouch machines

Excellent service from the man on the phone! He helped me through the menu like he made it himself. I took his recommendation on a couple things including the coconut shrimp and WOW!! Enough said!! But wait!!! There's more!! Lol .. He also told me the chef was fast and my food would be ready in 10 minutes. And it was!! I drove there immediately, and I live literally 7 minutes away. Everything tastes immaculate. Also when I walked in to pick up my food he greeted me genuinely and offered me a drink to go. Spot on!! And at 6 am? So awesome for us night owls. 
Price was $25 and some change for an order of coconut shrimp, a triple dip w/ fresh tortilla chips, and a great portioned size sweet potato fry. 
Fabulous and I WILL be back.

Came here a few Sundays ago for breakfast. YUUMMM!! the inside of this place is really much more gorgeous than we expected. Nice and spacious. We were the onlys inside. The owner was a our waitress and was fabulous.  My 9 year old son was in a bad mood and shes was totally accomidating. When they didn't have the drink he wanted she made him a special drink .. which was really good. 
They variety or food is great. Everyone god what they wanted. Food was yummy.  Well definitely need to head back for dinner. Woodfired pizzas... even a rootbeer float waffle or a smores pizza for dessert.  Were else can you get this!! Need to check it out

Over the years, I've dined here a few times, and it just keeps getting better. I've had a great burger and some good brunches. Who doesn't dig a good brunch?!

For breakfast today we tried:
~Chocolate Chip pancake for our kiddo
~Poached Egg Eye opener, hash browns, sausage patties with extra side of fruit and rye
~Eye Opener over medium, bacon with sourdough and, of course, had to go for their Bottomless Mimosas on Sat & Sun morning for $15. Our food was a solid breakfast; eggs poached nicely, over medium done right, a HUGE kid's plate of chocolate chip cakes that we all shared. Bacon was cooked crisp enough, the kiddo LOVED the sausage patties, the hash browns needed more browning, but that was a first. Toasts were great -rye especially. The fruit this a.m. was a cup of strawberries, a nice fresh little treat. Our server kept the mimosas coming, they seemed like a decent quality champagne - no headache to speak of- and a good ratio of orange juice-to-champagne. No complaints here. 

Service was good, informative - we found out about some fun happenings offered here, check them out below. The (owner?) or manager has stopped by to check on us each time we come in, which I appreciate. 

Other fun events hosted here:
Karaoke on Saturday nights 10pm-1am
Acoustic Open Mic Sunday 9:30pm-1am
Starting a Thursday night soul music night by Michael Grimm ~ I believe he won America's Got Talent one season... should be fun!
Jesse is the best!! The chicken fingers with hot sauce on the side is my favorite

Had lunch with a friend here. Ordered the California chicken sandwich with fries. The bread was extremely buttery but the chicken was moist. I ate the chicken separate from the the bacon and avocado. Still very good! The fries however were a tad bit over seasoned with seasoning salt. Asked for ranch on the side which would be great for a salad but not fries. It was a lil on the thick side. The amount of fries wasn't very much from what I'd think it should have been for the price. Had a club soda to drink and the waiter went the whole meal before asking to refill our cups. My daughter had the kids Mac and cheese w/bread stick. The portion was great for a kid. Presentation was nice. The noodles weren't your average mac and cheese noodles. They were more like an Olive Garden type pasta dish. Very cheese! Thumbs up on that.

This was a pleasant surprise! I got a Living Social deal and it was nearby. Reviews here seemed decent, so why not?
Most everything is made from scratch. The blue cheese salad dressing was second only to my own homemade blue cheese dressing...and it's even possible it might be as good as mine.
BF's chili was excellent.
My chicken marsala was a bit rich for me but it was still very decent.
Great service.
I'd definitely go back again.
Edit: I've been back and this place was dead as a doornail. I don't get it. There should be lines around the corner. I think it's a bit out of the way and I know I had a hard time remembering the name of the place so maybe that doesn't help.

The food here is the best bar food in town. It would be a sad day if Vegas lost such a great family restaurant. I'm taking it to 5 stars as a "best in class" because it has great prices and great home made food.

This place has really good food.  We used Groupon and had the seared ahi tuna, meatzla pizza and meatloaf.  All were excellent. 

The service was a tad slow at first but the poor girl was by herself while it was kinda busy and she was very kind.

The 1 star off of 5 stars is for price.  Just a bit high but when combined with the Groupon it was a good deal.

I honestly do not know how this place is still in business. It is always dead every time we have come in and for the life of me I can not understand why. The food was pretty good, gambling, friendly prompt staff, and games. 

If your looking for nice service and a chill atmosphere check this place out.

I would give service 5 stars! Great customer service.

But I only give the restaurant and food 2 stars. Like how the place is decorated. Feels very comfy in there. Just needs some art up on the walls. But the food was no good! Took very long for our food. There was only 2 other parties in the restaurant. I ordered a California Turkey sandwich. They forgot the avocado and put way too many chiles on the sandwich. I could of made a better one at home. My husband had a parm chicken sandwich and the chicken was burnt and over cooked. The chicken was also flat and way too thin. The chicken sandwich cost $12! Way over priced. We could come back if the quality of the food was better and not over price. Never even saw a manger. They did take the chicken sandwich off the bill but the manager never came over and talked to us. Poor management. I have worked in restaurants for years and know what kind of service restaurants should give.

I've been coming here for the last month. The new menu is great. The prices are low and reasonable. The service is amazing. Everyone is really helpful and polite. I love the burgers and sliders. Try the jalapeño burger. It's delicious. The dining area is large and clean. 
Never too crowded. The bar area is kind of small but nice as well. I recommend that you come here and enjoy yourself.

Honestly, I didn't have a good feeling once we tried to order and found they didn't have a few different things (Coriss cross fries listed on the menu, Greek dressing for their Greek salad), but our experience in the end was actually quite positive. I ordered the Greek Salad and it was quite good. I had the balsamic dressing since they didn't have the Greek dressing and honestly, I never would have known that this wasn't the normal dressing. My daughters both ordered different chicken sandwiches and they both liked what they ordered. The onion rings that came with my oldest daughter's sandwich were really good. There was an issue with my oldest daughter's meal when it first came out, but they fixed the problem and it worked out fine. 

Bottom line is that the food is decent, but at the end of the day our server made it a good experience even though we were off to a rocky start. I hate it when I forgot to get names so I will describe her. She was blond with should length hair and maybe in her 30's or early 40's. (sorry if I a wrong). She was the only server at the time we came because it was in between lunch and dinner. I hope the manager knows who I am speaking of so they can thank her for offering such great service. This could easily have been a two star review if not for her.

I've had two experiences here. The first I was really wanting eggs Benedict and when I came in,  breakfast was over.  :(  But they were accommodating and made them for me anyways.  So good... plus they have a few variations of Benedict.  The second experience was this morning.  I was wanting a bloody and this just happened to be the closest bar.  The bartender was very nice, he came over and greeted me the second i came in.  He made my bloody the way I wanted with Chalula instead of Tabasco,  no olives.  It came in a point glass and was perfect! I wish I would have gotten his name.   I most definitely will start making a point of coming here more often.
I hope more people start going. My 2 sons and I love their breakfast and it separated nicely from the bar so you do not have to worry about any smoke.

We visited today on a friend's recommendation. The food was excellent, but the service was really disappointing. No one greeted us when we walked in; after a few minutes, someone who appeared to be a cook came out and showed us to our seats. He also got us our drinks. The server took a while to turn up- she was the only server, and had a few other tables, so we just figured she was busy. It turned out that she was just really inattentive. After we finally placed our order, it took about twenty minutes for our food to arrive. The server dropped the food off, and took off without asking if we needed anything else, or offering any condiments. I was irked because I wanted some ketchup or mayo for my fries, so I decided to start with my sandwich and wait til she came back to check on us to ask for it. It took her a really long time to check back, though, because a group came in that appeared to be regulars, and she was busy chatting with them. By the time she did come back, my husband had finished his iced tea, so we asked for a refill and a side of mayo. She said she'd be right back with them, but we never got those items. Meanwhile, the table of regulars got their food very quickly, and had a table laden with condiments. It was incredibly irritating. The server came by with our check, never even mentioning the side of mayo or the refill. She offered a box, which I said yes to. I'm not sure why she bothered, because I never got my box, either. When she came to collect her money from us, we were wrapping my sandwich in a napkin. We got no apology, nor did she offer the box again. We left pretty pissed off, especially because we'd tipped fairly well. It seems that you only get good service here if you are a regular- which is a stupid way to operate, because how can you build new regulars if you treat people badly on their first visit? The food was great, so I'd order take out from this joint, but never again will we go in and sit down.

I have only ate here once and it was for breakfast but I will be returning shortly. 

We ordered the pancakes banana's foster and the ranchero. 

While the wait was a bit long after we ordered, but it was very much worth the wait.

The pancakes were off the chain! I usually only have pancakes once every one or two years unless they are cooked at home and next time I go here I imagine that I order these! I haven't ever had pancakes this good I don't believe. 

The ranchero breakfast was also very good, but I like the pancakes much better. 

The ambiance and the decorations for Christmas were great, and the staff was even better, they were friendly attentive and not over attentive.

Moved to the neighborhood a year ago. Went to Brentwood then and it was weird and sad. Karaoke at like 4pm, but hey, that's just me. We didn't return until a year later.

So now they have no gambling machines. The bar has empty spots now, that's weird. I've never seen someone do away with gambling. They have a separate non-smoking room, which I'm assuming is for families.

I overheard some lady order a bloody mary. She took a sip and refused to drink it. From what I overheard, it was just tomato juice seasoning and vodka. Yuck. She said she stopped by just for a drink but decided to order food. She had the bartender box the food up before it even came out. 

We were there on a Saturday morn at about 10. There was another couple that walked in right after us. Their food came out first, but it was actually ours. We noticed the mistake before the server even did. We already waited 20 minutes for a burger and omelette, so we weren't going to wait any longer. We put 3 bucks down for the drink and just left.

My girlfriend had a groupon too, but we just walked out. She's going to seek a refund for the groupon. I can't see them being in business much longer. The bartender had three customers when we were there, and she messed up all of their orders. She even had a double play when giving our food to the ONLY other customer in the establishment. I don't know why you would go to this place. My idea was that all the breakfast spots would be packed in the a.m., this way we could get breakfast pretty quick. That was my mistake.

The screens are way too small to see any detail. The music (though different than your typical place) was pretty depressing and weird. Think all the forgotten rockabilly artists. One screen was cool though. It made all the soccer players blue. It was a neat game of smurf on smurf. 

You can do better than this place. I don't know you, but you are better than this. This is coming from a guy who loves 7-11's hot dogs.

EDIT:4/10/14
Back selling food w a smaller menu. Pizza and artichoke dip still on there though and as amazing as ever. Seems the lady Robin is cook waitress and bartender so be patient if service is slow.

EDIT: 1/11/13 
This place has since closed its restaurant down and only has the bar open, bye bye to the best spinach artichoke dip - *sad face*

I LOVE this place! It's so close to us. The appetizers are the way to go as far as the food - spinach artichoke dip with chips (or bread is okay too) and the chicken wings are amazing! The Alfredo with Fettuccine and chicken is oily and cheesy and delicious as well. And a nod to the Margarita pizza. Casey is the best waiter, super nice and efficient. I really like that you can take your dogs here and eat on the patio. The first times we went here (closer to their opening) they brought out a couple doggy biscuits for the pug. Around Halloween they had a costume contest for dogs and Binkey won! Great appetizers and drinks and a good atmosphere even when it's quiet.
Bartenders are great every time, Carey, Tamara, Brian are awesome at the bar. Food is really good.

Yes the place was empty but I have no idea why. $15 bottomless mimosas Saturday & Sunday 9am-3pm and they don't use the cheap stuff like everywhere else does for $20. I got the eggs benedict, some of the best I have ever had and I order eggs benedict everywhere I go. Eggs perfectly cooked with creamy hollondaise. My husband got bacon french toast. Perfect balance of salty and sweet. Great bartender (Jesse), our bottomless mimosas never saw their bottom. Introduced himself, engaged in conversation, gave recommendations off the menu. The menu looks so good we are planning at least 4 more trips to try everything. I will update on our next visit.

Brentwood is one of my favorite places to grab a drink with friends!!! The bartenders are so fun and chill. And OMG  the chicken nachos are seriously the best in town!!! The nacho toppings go all the way through so ever chip is covered.... Yum I like crave them!! 

On Saturdays the karaoke is great! Tamara the bartender is so fun, she makes you feel so at home. If my friends and I want chill night away from the strip we always choose Brentwood! Close to home and fun!

What a great place to have dinner and come in and play! Our Bartender John was so hospitable, he took very good care of us and made sure my Stone IPA that was on Draft was never empty! I even had a little luck, I hit Four Aces with a kicker  ;)

The food is awesome as well! The Garden Pizza and the Loaded Nachos were soooooo damnnn Good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place is just great, I get the same great service wether i'm at a machine or sitting in a booth on a date, the food and service is just superb!

First visit here today, and I was not impressed.  As soon as I stepped out of my car, I noticed a strong sewage odor.  No big deal, as it's Vegas and that happens often.  As I walked in, I noticed the smell was also inside the building, and just as strong. 

We went into the restaurant side, which was completely dead at 1pm.  There is a  sign that tells you to sit anywhere (no hostess).  The bartender brought us menus and took our drink order.  When she brought the drinks back, one was overflowing and spilled over onto her, then on both mine and my husband's feet (which were under the table), and finally over the table. No apologies and no offer to clean it up...and no napkins in sight.  She was nice though, so I didn't complain. 

Next, our waiter, who I'm pretty sure was also the cook, took our order. The food took about 20-25 minutes to get to us, and no one came to check on us for drink refills  during that time.  Food arrives, and my pizza was missing an ingredient.  I asked if it was on the pizza, and I was told no because most people would ask for it if they wanted it.  Keep in mind, this ingredient is specifically listed as a part of the pizza on the menu.  He went back to the kitchen to bring me the missing ingredient without huffing and refilled my husband's drink, so again, I didn't complain.

That was the only interaction we had while there, in a completely dead restaurant with only two other people in it.  I watched a waitress with short curly hair walk away from the other table as the customer called out to her to take her menu. The waitress didn't even turn around.  As the customer sat it back on the table, the waitress hollered something over her shoulder, again without turning around.  I couldn't understand exactly what she said, but she still did not pick the menu up. 

As I was waiting, I had time to look around.  I noticed a thick layer of dust on top of the wooden separators between booths and took a pic to post here.  With a lack of customers, I imagine there is enough time to at least clean up the restaurant. 

When we finally saw the cook/waiter again, we asked for the check and I paid without even looking at it so we didn't have to wait any longer to leave. I absolutely did not want to leave a tip, but left $3.00 on a $40 bill (overpriced based on food quality, service, and setting) only out of pity for the poor guy pulling double duty in a non-crowded tavern.

I'm really disappointed in this place, because I really did want to love it

Attitude is very important for me. Everyone here has always been great. They have an excellent Happy hour that includes half off apps and discounted wells and beers. Plenty of tv 's to watch all the games. Full menu is not the same barga I need as HH, but food is great. check out the special hangover blood h mar u that has a mini burger attached

Sometimes you just want a good Bloody Mary.  Sure, bacon and lots of stuff is welcome, but at it's heart, a Bloody Mary is tomato juice mixed with ingredients that can include, but are not limited to:  Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, horseradish, celery, olives, salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, lemon juice, and celery salt.  You get the picture.  

Proportions are also key.  Too much of any one or two ingredients and it's a bit like a great looking girl with one huge hairy toe...nothing gets noticed except the toe.  

The Bloody Mary's at the Brentwood Café are so bad that they are literally closer to a marinade for tough, low quality steak than a drink.  As best as I could tell it was 77% cheap steak sauce, then bad tomato juice...undrinkable.  

To top it off the place was woefully understaffed, so getting the check to leave our table full of untouched Bloody Mary's took uncomfortable minutes, and the waitress didn't even question as to if we liked the drinks.

I met a girlfriend Saturday morning for breakfast.  This place is really cute. Lots of stacked stone and comforting hues.  

I was unaware it was a college football bar alumni thing so the loud football on 47 tv's was annoying during my breakfast.  

Regardless, I was pleasantly surprised when my exact order turned out to be on special.  Unfortunately, I did not get the details if this happens every Saturday or what?  2 eggs, choice of bacon or sausage, hashbrowns and toast for $2.79. Crazy!  I upgraded to tenaya potatoes which made it a whopping $3.29.  

It was delicious.  Sausage was excellent.  Eggs cooked to perfection.  Potatoes flavorful.  

The service was a bit shotty.  We ended up getting everything we needed but it also got served with a bit of cranky.  It was slow but we weren't in a hurry so it all worked out fine.  

I've been for breakfats twice now, and I'll go again.

Good lunch food - in our group we had the fish sandwich, pepperoni pizza, and a big salad. The ingredients seem quality and the prices are excellent. Plus extra points because they have a couple good entree salads. 
Happy hour prices are super duper cheap - like $2 beers, $3 wells.
Only went to meet the hubs for lunch because it's near his work. Won't likely be back for the weekend scene, but it sounds interesting.
This place rocks!  Cool, modern decor.  Food is wonderful and at a very fair price.  All of the staff were very warm and kind and attentive.  Will be going back there soon!

I've been to this place 3 times and it wasn't until the last time that I finally enjoyed my visit. 
I've been there for breakfast, the food was ok, it wasn't anything special or that you couldn't get at any number of places. The service was horrendous! I had to find someone to seat us. We were the only 2 people in the entire place (including the bar) 
I've been there for lunch (in the bar), once again service was not good everything took much longer than it should for a place that at it's busiest while we were there at 10 people. We got a lot of "I'll be right back's" and they never were. We left to do the rest of our drinking some place that would treat us better when they took our money. 
Finally I went for dinner and the experience was much better. The guy who waited on us Casey (?) was great. A little overwhelmed at time but he seemed to be the only one there and the place was actually fairly busy (for once). The food was great and he made sure we understood what we were getting. If the service was like that everytime we went in I know we would go back quite often. 
The food is pretty good and the atmosphere is nice, I guess they have a couple of fire places outside which I hope to take advantage of next time we go!

Hidden Gem.

She's an awesome spot to watch a game and throw back a few drinks. Decor is modernized.

We came in here during the football season and they had an awesome special, 24oz (or more, can't remember) beer, chicken pesto sandwich & fries for $10!!! Sandwich is full of flavor and the beer is served in a goblet so the price is well worth it.

Our bartender was great! Service was awesome, love this place!
Stopped in on the way across town, super hungry & found this place!! Awesome burgers & super quick service!!! Ginger makes the biggest and best burgers in town!!!

This place is is tucked away in a tiny little strip mall off of Warm Springs near Tenaya. The strip mall is almost vacant, save one other place (a Korean restaurant?). The area is still underdeveloped and so Brentwood doesn't get very much traffic. I think since it's so slow, they're only open til 2a. Kinda lame, but I see why. I'm sure if business picks up (and the area develops), they'll extend their hours, but I think that's a long way off. 

This isn't necessarily a bad thing. If you go on a week day, it's pretty uncrowded. They've only been open a couple of months so no one really knows about it. It's a place to go and talk with your company; not shout over ambient ruckus. It's a place to go and chillax; not people watch. 

The bar can be completely closed off from the restaurant side (in accordance with Las Vegas restaurant and smoking laws ... hooray). 

The women's bathroom stalls are shallow. Shallow like, walk in the stall and konk, hit your knee on the toilet. And there are no toilet seat liners in the last stall, but not the first two stalls (my friend is a germaphobe). 

The deco of the place is weird. It's definitely desert practical, but still has this weird austerity. 

When you first walk in the foyer, you can go one of three ways: the bar, the restaurant, the bathroom. It's kind of like entering a business office building. 

The bar side has a huge bar with video poker and also tables surrounding the bar, mostly 4-tops and half booths. 

Of the three evenings I've been there, I've never seen anyone on the restaurant side. 

There's also a dog-friendly patio outside. Neat. Totally trying to accomodate people that just want to have a cold one with their dog. I get it.
