Their menu is typical bar fare. I've only ever tried their spinach dip, $8. Nothing bad, nothing exceptional. Oh, the menu has no desserts. Booooooo. And hiss. BUT my accommodating bartender said there was some ice cream in the kitchen and he could whip something up for me. Hm. Ice cream and Bailey's? Perhaps next time. 

They have Kona Longboard on tap and ... some other stuff. 

I think the major selling point about Brentwood is their friendly staff. Granted, they're new and still have a while to go before they're all jaded and broken, but for now they are swell. I've had the privilege of being served by Huckleberry and Dustin. Huckleberry is a friendly bartender. Friendly to the point where he was whoring out shots. Look for the guy with the Moe (from the Simpsons) tattoo. Dustin was more low key and I found myself missing Huckleberry. But then as the bar emptied, Dustin warmed up a little more and really took the time and care to get us hammered. Such a sweetheart. We also met the two bartenders that just finished their shift, Jen and Lisa, with the nice boobies. Friendly. 

I'll be back.
Good beers on tap and very good service.  Lot's of food for the price
Recently started coming here for some drinks and food after work. Beer is always super cold and people are very nice. Great food as well....low key and relaxing.

Great happy hour, pizzas are good, have tried most, only one didn't care for was goat cheese. Relaxed atmoshpere, nice place to unwind and knock back a few beers after hard day of work! Gonna try breakfast there soon, have seen good reviews.

Been coming here off and on for a couple of years. The menu has recently changed and I am extremely impressed with the sesame ahi tuna - so much that I've finally written a review! 

You can get the ahi tuna as a salad or as a burger and both are huge portions. It is a generous filet of perfectly seared ahi tuna, tender in the middle and covered on the outside with sesame seeds. 

The tuna burger is topped with a little wasabi and some delicious Asian slaw, served on a potato bun. It comes with your choice of side, fries, onion rings, slaw, side salad etc. 

My fiancé was visiting recently from Australia, and we stopped at Brentwood a few times to have some drinks w friends. One of the nights we both ordered the ahi burger and he had been talking about it ever since. We were going to grab a bite to eat last week before going to meet my parents, and I asked him what he wanted. He said immediately that he had to have that sesame ahi from Brentwood. Really? You've been to Vegas twice and out of all the places to eat, you want to go to Brentwood? It must be pretty good!!!! 

So... This is my third time ordering the sesame ahi tuna and I was compelled to tell all the Yelpers about it. Yum! 

This place is also very big and the staff is super friendly. Tamara the bartender is super sweet and is always nice and bubbly, and waited on us today. 

They also recently upgraded the bar stools and TVs in the bar area. The TVs are are bigger and high definition, and there is a huge one on one of the bar walls that is perfect for football. They also have super fun karaoke on Saturday nights. Plus there is a separate huge nonsmoking dining lounge that is kid friendly. 

Sometimes it looks dark here from the outside and appears to be closed, but trust me, they're open! The food and service are awesome.

Garbage. We came for drinks and food on a Friday night. This is where it gets good....wait for it....They were inexplicably not serving food...At a restaurant?! Okay fine, I ordered a jack and coke. The coke was stale and flat and poured from a 2 litre! WTF? The bartender suggested I order a pizza?! All of this while the saddest assortment of dads lived out their pathetic rock and roll fantasies via bad (bad!) Covers of easy listening jams from yesteryear.  If you ever find yourself tempted to come here, do yourself a favor and just kill yourself instead.

Found this little place from Groupon and didn't even realize I drive by it every day on my way to work.

Pros:
Quick service
Huge portions
Super cold drinks

Cons: 
Kinda empty
Location
Too dark

So, let's get down to basics! The food? Oh my god where do I begin with the food?! I ordered a burger that must've been straight from the gods... jalapeños,  a big, juicy,  medium rare beef patty (not frozen, the real thing), purple onions, fresh buns and literally smothered in their house sauce. Amazeballs!  The only issue I had with my order was I requested onion rings and my date asked for sweet fries--- we both got sweet fries. I was too polite to tell the waitress this wasn't what I wanted, and too hungry to cause a fuss. Any way, my date and I both ordered Heinekens (took a little while to get those) and he ordered a raspberry tea which came in this neat little Mason jar. The sweet fries were good but a little on the soft side and my date complained about the amount of bbq sauce on his burger. Other than that, it was a great place to grab a bite to eat, quiet and out of the way. Will be returning again, with a larger group!
Everything here is AWESOME! The Hangover Breakfast is great, just like everything else on the menu. The ahi tuna poke stack is amazing!!!!! You absolutely must try this local gem!

This is going to be one of my new hangouts. The bartenders are great. Brian was very attentive and friendly. The food was fabulous as well. Not your typical bar food. Lots of flavors and lots of great options. The pizza was melt in your mouth good and the nachos were fully loaded and massive. 

I didn't know what to get off the menu. I hear the burgers are delicious here and that their southwest egg rolls are an awesome starter. I'll definitely have to go back ASAP and give those a try. 

Clean place, clean facilities, great bartenders, good late night food and clean crowd. I give this place 2 thumbs up!

This is the worst bar in las vegas,  they do not care about local business,  they will charge you the maximum. It is evident they care nothing about repeat business. They must think they are actually on the strip with their ridiculous prices. For a place that is always empty, the employees need to justify there jobs by charging and milking you for every cent. Even if you gamble expect a large bill. BEWARE!!!

We were given a resturant.com gift card from Brentwood Cafe so we stopped in one night last week. We have driven by a ton of times and never stopped but now we're kicking outseles for not! This place was great, clean, nicely decorated and a big selection!

My boyfriend and I tried this place since he moved to a new place very close to this cafe. We should have bolted for the door at the first bad sign....it was Sunday morning and there was only 2 tables occupied in the whole restaurant. Secondly the place REEKS of old stale smoke.

Lets start off with saying that the breakfast menu leaves much to be desired as listed on the menu. VERY small and poor selection. Even then, don't be fooled by what they have to offer.
My boyfriend ordered steak and eggs. The waitress told him they were out of steak because they sold them all the night before.....okayyy. So then he ordered a waffle. She then proceeded to tell him that they don't have waffles either because the waffle iron had been BROKEN FOR A YEAR!!!!!! He then asked her what they did have so he know what to order, so she said they were also out of steak, pork chops, fruit and a few other items. Another sign that we should have left, but we didn't. 

Okay...so we both ordered french toast (as it seemed that's the only thing they had) and the BF asked to add the pecans on the french toast. LOW AND BEHOLD she comes back and said they didn't have any pecans, but they had walnuts. 

This place was just horrible. It looks really nice and modern from the outside and even on the inside. The food was mediocre and their inventory SUCKED. Management is obviously not taking care of business. I felt bad for the waitress because it wasn't her fault but she was the one that had to deal with it.

Food was ok.  Lack of service should be expected.  The restaurant is totally empty except for our table and when we need something, we had to walk into the kitchen to find the server who was hanging out in the back.  Bartender' family came in and appears to be free loading on the joint as none of their food/drinks were rung up and he's telling the cooks what to make since they didn't get a ticket.  People are walking from the bar/smoking area to the restaurant area to look for the bartender.

I don't expect this place to be in business much longer.

The service here was abysmal. We sat ourselves and the server brought us menus without saying anything. She came back and just goes "What do you want?" We felt like she was annoyed that she had to serve us. The restaurant side was empty aside from our table. 

Our burger and sandwich was OK, but there are plenty of other places in the area with better food and service. Don't waste your time here.

Each time we eat here the menu gets better and the food never disappoints.  everything is delicious and breakfast all day,  cant beat that.  staff is very friendly and accommodating.  they have a great hangover breakfast sandwich too.

We love Dollar Taco Tuesdays!  okay...my hubby likes them because they are ground beef; if they had chicken tacos for 2 bucks, I probably would partake.  What else is good is a cup of the chicken tortilla soup!  Along with the plentiful chicken, are chunks of avocado and a kick of some hot spice.
I also had the homemade tiramisu dessert which was the best I have had in a long time.
The waiter was very customer service oriented.
Yes, we will be back!

I really used to like this place but I've had some negative experiences the last couple times.... Once I came in to game and all the machines were down.  I understand that shit happens, so nbd. On my next visit I ring the doorbell and knock on door with no success, I ended up at pts down the street. Then last night, the same thing. I'm here to drink and gamble but even with all the lights and tvs on, no one answered the door. Again, I ended up at pts. I want to like Brentwood, but i can't even get in the door. Place has a lot of potential.

I came here with a groupon and the service was great. We had nachos, the Ahi salad and a burger. The food was great and very reasonable prices. The restaurant area was really nice with dark wood and comfortable seating. I highly recommend you try this place.

As soon as I get to the bar I'm greeted by the bartender she asks what id like. Right as I ask her a question the cook comes into the bar and yells the bartenders name.. And says get over here.. They start talking and I consider leaving.. But I stayed. Finally get my drink. None of the table games are working where I'm sitting.. Beer tastes watered down. And the cook came into yelling 3 more times. Even though it wasn't loud or busy. In fact she was louder than the Gabe on. Even though I was there to watch the game I left as soon as I finished my drink. Went to another bar.  No wonder there was only 6 people there on a Friday night during nba finals.

I can't believe we drove past this bar for years without stopping! 

Over the past year or so, we've gone regularly to Brentwood and never had a bad time. The bartenders are personable and good at their jobs (so sad Billy is leaving!). They don't mind giving suggestions either. The food is excellent compared to other local bars. We love the chicken parm, enchiladas, flatbreads, and all of the apps! 

On holidays there is always some kind of party happening. Gaming machines are usually kind. The bartenders are great about not nickel and diming for drinks while playing video poker/keno! Some bars base your comps on coin in and will still charge for drinks even if you've been playing up and down for hours. This isn't one of those places! 

There are karaoke nights. A whole large dining room is available for family dining too. 

We love Brentwood! The location is a little strange, but definitely swing by to give it a try. Awesome local feel!!

We found out that they have karaoke here on Saturday nights so I convinced the fiance to stop for one drink and MAYBE one song.  We ended befriending the karaoke host and some of the regulars and staying until 1am and singing like 4 songs. We had a blast! The bartenders were super friendly. We will be back for karaoke!
This place is 1st Class all the way.  Great food, great staff, amazing karaoke!  A wonderful week to spend any day of the week!

Sitting in the booth stuffed. The food was pretty good. A large menu to choose from: pizza, burgers, sandwiches, pastas, and breakfast. 

However, I was a little disappointed when I found out the breakfast menu is limited for the all day. I am a big breakfast girl and I work hospitality hours so breakfast is really dinner time. When I get a craving for pancakes it doesn't go away. So when I heard about their root beer float pancakes I had to try them. I checked the menu and it said 24/7 online. But when I got there I was so disappointed. Only a few items were served all day. No pancakes for me. 
I had the eggs Benedict and it was really good though! 

We are the only ones in here! The staff is super friendly! I really like the look of this place too! The bar is separated from the dinning area with lots of TVs. But you can still see the TVs from the dinning area. The decor is classy and had a nice family restaurant feel. And they do have a really cool patio with a fireplace for those 2 winter months. 

I'm defiantly coming back. I know it's a hit when my boyfriend stops talking because his mouth is full of food!

After the owner messages me following my review, we decided to visit this weekend for lunch. I will they there is great improvement on the service. Our server Elizabeth was very good, even with it being her second week. She was very attentive. My only complaint this time was the staff seemed to have trouble locating things (examples were To go cups and lids for plastic kids cups). Other than that it was much better than last time service wise. The food on the other hand has not changed which is a great thing. Their food is great we have not had a bad thing here. It is definitely worth a visit and chances are you will be hooked on their great food as well!

This bar has potential, the ambience is great and if it wasn't for carey the grave yard bar tend we would not have been repeat customers.  My husband and i came in for a few drinks and got stuck with a $125 tab. My husband took the high road, paid it and even tipped but the itemized check was wrong but who can argue with the bar manager. If you want to pay strip club prices and leave with no buzz this is the place for you.  Locals beware.

Nice place but service was just ok. Bartender was our server and we had to walk over to bar to ask for something. Food was average. Prices compared to Aces down the street doesn't compare. Was my first time and will be my last.
Mmmmmmmmmmmm. ..... nachos and Brentwood burger fries drinks!!! Sooooooo yummmy! Our new fun place!!! Service and place so clean and 100% on top of everything

It was ok, the beer was in a huge glass!  you needed 2 hands to keep it steady.  Even when it was empty, it was heavy.  The Guacamole and chips were awsome, the chips were right out of the fryer!  We got the ribeye, and veggies, it was good.  It wasn't awsome, I don't think it leaves a memory....After this review, I'm sure I will forget about this place.
The cheese cake wasn't bad at all, we got the rasberry topping on it.

Great little spot with a much more sophisticated menu than I expected.  I have eaten here several times now for both meals and appetizers and drinks during networking events.  The BBQ chicken salad is massive and loaded with flavor.  Definitely a great choice for a substantial hunger. Southwest flavors of avocado and a corn salsa crown this yummy selection.  A few onion rings for a crunchy,  decadent touch were a perfect addition.  

Today,  for a lighter selection,  the Ahi salad was a great choice. The creamy Wasabi dressing drizzled over the dish was the perfect amount of heat to compliment the perfectly seared tuna. Sesame ginger dressing on the side was a lovely sweet compliment to balance the heat wasabi and richness of the ahi. 

On the beverages, the bloody Mary,  Virgin or full on, is amazing. I joked Wuthering the bartender it's basically a salad ina glass with all the delicious bits of celery and onion in the glass.  Until this drink,  i never had bacin flavored hot sauce and salt.  Bacon flavored hot sauce and bacon salt is something I need more of in my life.  Lol! Try it?

My wife and I gave Brentwood a shot last night. Very nice place, the atmosphere and staff are friendly and the pricing is on point. I really wasn't impressed with the food, though. I ordered the open-faced chili burger and it was probably the most flavorless, unseasoned meal I had in a long time. I discarded the bread for dietary reasons and the tater tots (my real cheat portion) were good, though. 

I'll give them another shot pretty soon. They were understaffed last night and our server did his very best to keep us smiling, which was awesome. Plus I didn't get to try the bar side out as I'm not drinking at the moment, so that's worth a try as well.

Great happy hour. Sliders are great, especially the jalapeño sliders. Grilled artichoke is a rare, but fantastic find. Tex Mex rolls are great as well. Servers are kind and friendly. Beer and wine prices are very reasonable.
Bartender was nice. As for food, not so much. I ordered chicken penne pasta and it was a bowl of olive oil really. I'm sure everything else is fine, but not that dish.

So...I've been here a few times over the last couple of years, and while the bar and staff are great, and the food is good....i do not like karaoke hosts that take breaks and sing when there are more than 8 people who want to sing.  

There are at least 11 singers tonight,  and we've only sang 2 songs in 3.5 hours.  Not to mention,  at the end of the night, one guy sang 3 times in a row because he tipped.  As a former karaoke host myself,  you NEVER put people back to back.   Yes, let him sing twice in the rotation, but FFS, there are other peoplewho want to sing too. 

I'll come back for the bar, but not karaoke.  The sound isn't very good either.

Great local neighborhood bar with good food.

Been wanting to try this place for awhile, and finally got the chance.  We were there a little early for dinner (5ish), so it was pretty quiet in their dining area.  I got the California chicken sandwich which was served on grilled sourdough (yum!), with a side of sweet potato fries which were dusted with a light sprinkling of powdered sugar (yum yum!).  Hubby got the homemade chicken enchiladas - sauce was a little spicey, but he liked them and thought overall it was good flavor.  

Oh, and as an appetizer, we got the pretzel bites, which was served with a side of cheese sauce - those were pretty yummy too!

We didn't have LO with us, but we asked, and they do have a kids menu.  Also, the bar and dining area pretty well separated by a door, so you're not getting smoked out.

Service was pretty good too.  Overall, a great experience, good food, and the menu was pretty varied - would like to try other things on their menu.

Items Selected:
Warm Pretzel Bites with Queso
Two Fresh Baked Biscuits
Banana Pecan French Toast - Fresh bananas & pecans inside & on top, dusted with powdered sugar, served with maple syrup & butter
All-star Root Beer Float Pancakes - Root beer baked inside the batter, topped with French vanilla ice cream & whipped cream, served with maple syrup

Recently under new management, and located slightly adrift of where one's GPS might suggest on West Warm Springs Road, Brentwood Café and Tavern was brought to my attention by a couple sitting next to me the week prior at Old School Brewing Company and featuring a similar 24/7 format with a family friendly dining area separate from the 21 and older bar and gaming area an early morning visit was planned - my 6:55am arrival finding only a young graveyard shift bartender, line cook, and janitorial staff present in the surprisingly large space.

Divided into two sections, the larger dining area not open until 8am thus relegating me to thankfully uninhabited and largely smokeless lounge, it was with friendly service from the barman named Jesse that I was greeted and opting for water over booze a few questions about the menu were answered before a two-course order was crafted, the youngster clearly acknowledging the need to confirm items with a kitchen that still managed to botch one half of the four items chose.

Oddly lit, with red lights overhanging tables and a multi-hued system centered at the bar, it was with a trio of slatted windows open to sunshine that I sat in waiting and although the WiFi was down the combination of SportsCenter and a soundtrack featuring Soudgarden, Nirvana, and Niko Case managed to keep me entertained until savory selections arrived, the fluffy biscuits proving well crafted despite being delivered without any jam or butter while a basket of salty pretzel bites with a pot of creamy queso was admittedly quite good, though certainly not worth $9.49.

Clearly not familiar with the breakfast menu, having to write down the second half of my order and again relay it to the kitchen, it was only after a fairly sizable delay that plates three and four emerged from the back and although the French Toast was the richly saturated sort that I love, crisp over custard beneath sliced bananas and toasty nuts, the "All Star" pancakes were anything but what was promised - the flavor entirely devoid of root beer and arriving completely stark despite the menu promising both whip and ice cream, the later only arriving once I pointed out the error, my own 100% maple syrup brought from home added to make the fluffy triple-stack much improved.

Friendly in service and featuring an excellent soundtrack I only wish the food and overall experience at Brentwood Tavern would have been as good,  some of my issues undoubtedly due to the timing of my arrival but others simply due to poor execution with none of it on par with several local competitors in the 24-hour scene.

So we stopped in for a snack and to check out the place. We were greeted quickly at the door and seated. The dining room was empty. 2  other groups came in while we were there. Our waitress was friendly and helpful.
We decided to order an order of Medium Chicken Wings, Tex Mex Spring Rolls, and a side of French Fries. For bar food everything was very good, cooked perfectly and flavorful. 
We would go back and try some other items from their menu.

I've been here twice and the food is reminiscent of the stuff you find in the frozen food aisle at Sam's Club.     Not bad, but nothing to get excited about.  Happy  hour is 4-7 and they offer 50% all apps, pizza & drinks. The bartender wasn't sure how to make a bloody mary and they didn't have any worcestershire sauce in the whole restaurant, so she used A1.  The drink ended up tasting like a spicy glass of A1.  Despite Happy Hour's offer of 50% off all well drinks I was charged full price @ $8 because they consider a bloody mary to be a specialty cocktail.

On a second visit the bartender was much better.  Because of my previous experience, I decided to go with a glass of Chardonnay instead of a steak sauce tobasco cocktail.  He rewarded me with generous refills and comped my wine.

Place is legit. Have had dinner and breakfast here and was happy both times. More people should come here and spread the word. The vibe is chill and the staff is somewhat nice, some need a "tip" of smile and be nice

California Chicken Sandwich with extra chipotle mayo.  If I had to pick a bar food its definetly #1 on the list compared to others!  Definitely coming back and you can eat in the dining area w/o smoke and see TV!!!

Solid choice for food on this side of town, and the price is incredible when you use a restaurant.com certificate.

My only real big complaint is that the salads, while seemingly original and diverse, aren't as fresh as I think they could be.  Yes, I am talking about the vegetables.  If you're a veggie freak, this may disappoint you, because they really accommodate vegetarians and those with restricted diets better than most restaurants around the area.   Otherwise, I have not had a bad meal here.  They do meat very well and have really good specials.  Service is also pretty spectacular.  

Another warning, if you go here when they have some of their assorted bands playing, and you care about talking to the other diners in your party, you won't be able to hear them at all.  My suggestion - go into the bar.  One night I was there, they featured a Doors cover band, which I found cool but I couldn't carry on a conversation with my husband in the regular restaurant area.  Going into the bar helps this but then you have to deal with all the yucky smokers.

I would choose this place to eat over Born and Raised, which is just up the street.  Less pretentious and hip, better and much cheaper food.  Not to mention, they serve beer out of really cold and large goblets (see attached photo).
Great staff.  Love the new menu.  Always friendly.  Like the cigar smoke room .

You know how you get really into a band that no one knows about, and you tell everyone about it because you want to support them, and then like a year later they blow up and everyone loves them and there's a little piece of you that's kind of annoyed but you don't know why?

Okay, maybe you don't know that feeling, but if you do, that's how I think Brentwood Cafe might turn out.  I want everyone to realize how awesome this place is.  However, I'm nervous that it will get so busy that I won't want to go there anymore.  Having said that, I'll continue going until it gets nuts.

Anyway, the staff is really friendly.  Always a plus.  The food is really good, and not the typical bar food either.  They have EVERYTHING.  We have been there for breakfast a few times. Omelettes are good.  We also went there for dinner and it was great.  Their guacamole is fresh and yummy. 

The biggest thing that appealed to me were their daily drink specials! Every day they have something awesome.  Ladies night Mondays- $3 martinis, Tuesdays are some sort of $1 Tacos...I know Sundays they have $15 bottomless mimosa and bloody marys! There are other specials, but I forgot exactly.  

Check them out.  I bet you'll be back.  It's such a nice change from indfifferent servers with sub-par food at crappy chain restaurants!

Best Tavern in Town

We usually go here for the breakfast.  They have the best pancakes in town, bar none.  Last night we tried the Happy Hour.  Great selection of draft beer (fat tire, newcastle).  I ordered the sliders and my wife orderd the brenwood pizza.  All I can say is this is our new happy hour place.  The beer was ice cold,  the sliders are superb,  the pizza is great also.  Kara, our waitress was the best.  We got there a minute after Happy Hour was over and she still gave us the Happy Hour prices.  Oh, I almost forgot, it's a dog friendly place.  Thank you Brentwood for great service and great food.

Eh, not that great.

Checked it out for the first time last night. Didn't realize it was karaoke night and it was LOUD! I have been to many karaoke bars and that dude had the volume up WAY too high on everything. It was making that scratchy too loud speaker sound, and making even the decent singers sound lousy. I was waiting for glass to start breaking on some of those notes.

We sat at a table and one of the bartenders came over with menus (sticky menus...huge pet peeve of mine..CLEAN YOUR STUFF) anyway, we ordered two burgers, soda and a beer. The bartender was very nice, but after we put our food order in, we waited, and waited and waited....by the time he brought it, you could tell it had been sitting under the lamp for a while, I think he just forgot about us. 

The burgers tasted ok, nothing to write home about and fairly overpriced for the location and kind of place this is. The fries were luke warm and dried out. Worst part is I was sick to my stomach very shortly after, which for me is always a sign of something I just ate, so something in that food did not agree with me, and considering the lack of clean menus, I shudder to think what it might have been. 

Definitely not worth a second trip.

Just moved in around the corner. Had dinner and a couple drinks at the bar the first visit. We had dinner with the family the second. The employees are nice, nachos are awesome, the oil didn't taste old, the place is clean, the drinks were good, and we loved everything about it. 

Give it a shot. Happy hour is between 3 and 6 and you can get those nachos for $5. That young kid who makes them is really talented. The bartender were really nice too. Nice to have a place this good close to home. I hope it stays this way.
Standard California chicken sandwich with 'steak fries' not exactly but ingredients were fresh soft chewy bread i will be back.

Let me open up with I'm new to the area. Went there Friday night for a beer with the lady. The place offers very little foot traffic paired with expensive appetizers, and expensive food. We were looking for a great place with good priced beers and good priced food; you know a local spot. What we found was $10 unappealing appetizers and a dreary environment. Staff was also inattentive and more interested in the other people there. Will not be back.

I've lived in the neighborhood for a couple years and never had been here before. I'm so glad I suggested it. The dining room was beautifully decorated for Christmas (a little early) and our server was attentive. Coffee was good and our breakfast was delicious. My husband got the Country Benedict. The gravy was delicious and had plenty of sausage in it. I got the standard two egg breakfast with sausage. The eggs were poached perfectly. The only thing I thought was a little odd was that I only got one slice of toast (with no butter). Other than that we had a great experience and will go back.
I've driven by this place a bunch of times but never stopped in. Glad I finally did. Burger and California sandwich both amazing. Everything from fries to gegitables were fresh and delicious!

Oh my god this place is so amazing! I had the Brentwood burger and I was blown out of my shoes! If you want a nice atmosphere with great service you have to come to this place. It's probably the best kept secret in Las Vegas. Once again 5 stars!

I brough my daughter here for lunch for her 1st legal 21st birthday bloody mary,  she picked it because of the yelp ratings. I was pleasantly surprised how good the service and the food was. We ordered pretzel bites, bbq cheeseburger, nachos, chicken quesadilla and mac n cheese. It was all very good. I will definitely come back to try their breakfast menu.
I've been waiting way too long to get my chicken burger.  Told me 6 minutes about 20 minutes ago.  This after they td me 40 mins ago that they were out of steaks.  Omg.  I won't be doing this again.

Ended up here for an impromptu happy hour on Thursday afternoon/evening. The bar area was clean and well kept, the bartender was great- very friendly and interactive, the food was good- decent bar food!

Great place to stop in for drinks, a bite to eat, and hanging out...

This place has come a long way. It is clean, friendly and the staff is great. But its always practically empty. Only been to the bar section, however now they have a pet friendly patio. Also it's now opened 24hrs.. I love this place!!

Maybe the best part or reason for coming here on game days: happy hour specials, aka 50% off, on all appetizers, which on Football Sunday's is essentially all day.

To balance that, for non-smokers, is well, the second hand smoke from all the generous smokers enjoying packs and packs of their cigarettes of choice. Sharing is caring I guess.

The Football Burger Special is what I ended up ordering (1/3 pound burger with side of fries), which is the most popular item to order with my group of friends. For $5.50 it is a decent burger, while you watch in agony or serenity as your team implode or dominate on the field. But even better than this classic burger is their crispy fries.

After watching the second half of this week's afternoon games, we walked out while the sun is still up, but smelling like I personally smoked 3-5 cigarettes. Glad I left my jacket in the car, even though it is brisk 57 F degrees.

Until next time. Maybe.

Went there yesterday (Sunday) with family. The place was beautifully decorated with Christmas stuff. There was just us & 1 other couple in the entire place. It looked like the place was at its last breath, but the server said they were . Server was nice, but it looked like his friends were there. He gave us 1 set of fork+knife. Sitting somewhere on the other side of this decor separator thing, he kept checking to see if we were almost done. At which point, he screamed:

(make this font size 32, in Comic Sans if you want)

ARE YOU GUYS HAVING DESSERT??!!?!?

As for the food...wild rice from a box, orange marmalade glaze from a jar, salmon that tasted like it had been freezer-burnt for a while (not a lot of people order the salmon, probably). Bar food. Wasn't absolutely horrible, but food always tastes OK when you're hungry.
Love this place! Amazing food, awesome staff, and good gaming. What else can I ask for. $15  bottomless mimosas on Saturday and Sunday's. Here all the time!
I really love this place. The nachos are some of the best in town, the staff is always friendly, and it's great for large groups.

They had one girl running the entire place. She was very pleasant. Food came out with ingredients that we not listed on the menu. The breakfast potatoes had bel peppers in them which was not stated. Unfortunately my boyfriend is deathly allergic to bel peppers we had to send his food back.  Food took long to begin with so wait was extremely long.
When everything finally came out the food was great. I had the veggie sandwich.  Overall customer service was great.
